metadata.title: Prevention of nosocomial transmission of swine-origin pandemic influenza virus A/H1N1 by infection control bundle

abstract.original_text: patient) were virologically confirmed with S-OIV. Not wearing a surgical mask either by the exposed persons during contact with the index cases (4/4 vs 264/832, P ¼ 0.010) or vice versa (4/4 vs 300/832, P ¼ 0.017, Fisher's exact test) were found to be significant risk factors for nosocomial acquisition of S-OIV.

sentences.segment_text: patient ) were virologically confirmed with S-OIV .

Not wearing a surgical mask either by the exposed persons during contact with the index cases ( 4/4 vs 264/832 , P 1/4 0.010 ) or vice versa ( 4/4 vs 300/832 , P 1/4 0.017 , Fisher 's exact test ) were found to be significant risk factors for nosocomial acquisition of S-OIV .
